name: Relay

packets.name: status_code
packets.description:
Reports the current state or error status of the device. ``code`` is a standardized value from 
the Jacdac status/error codes. ``vendor_code`` is any vendor specific error code describing the device
state. This report is typically not queried, when a device has an error, it will typically
add this report in frame along with the announce packet.

packets.name: status_code_changed
packets.description: Notifies that the status code of the service changed.

packets.name: instance_name
packets.description:
A friendly name that describes the role of this service instance in the device.
It often corresponds to what's printed on the device:
for example, `A` for button A, or `S0` for servo channel 0.
Words like `left` should be avoided because of localization issues (unless they are printed on the device).

packets.name: closed
packets.description: Indicates whether the relay circuit is currently on (closed) or off (closed).

packets.name: variant
packets.description: Describes the type of relay used.

packets.name: on
packets.description: Emitted when relay goes from ``off`` to ``on`` state.

packets.name: off
packets.description: Emitted when relay goes from ``on`` to ``off`` state.

packets.name: max_switching_current
packets.description: Maximum switching current for a resistive load.

source:
# Relay

    identifier: 0x183fe656

A switching relay.

## Registers

    rw closed: bool @ intensity

Indicates whether the relay circuit is currently on (closed) or off (closed).

    enum Variant: u32 {
        Electromechanical = 1,
        SolidState = 2,
        Reed = 3
    }
    const variant?: Variant @ variant

Describes the type of relay used.

## Events

    event on @ active

Emitted when relay goes from ``off`` to ``on`` state.

    event off @ inactive

Emitted when relay goes from ``on`` to ``off`` state.

    const max_switching_current?: u16 A @ 0x180

Maximum switching current for a resistive load.
